summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to defense counsel, transmitting a letter regarding a Rule 12.2 notice. It is a formal legal communication between prosecution and defense teams in the Epstein/Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of the email from the prosecution, indicating he is part of the defense counsel team.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim

events.title: Prosecution Sends Rule 12.2 Notice Letter
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney sends a formal letter to defense counsel regarding a Rule 12.2 notice, which typically relates to notice of an insanity defense or expert testimony on a defendant's mental condition.

locations.context: Office of the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, where the correspondence originated.

keyFacts: The document is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney to multiple defense attorneys, transmitting a formal letter.
The subject matter is a Rule 12.2 notice, which is a procedural step in federal criminal cases often related to mental health defenses or expert testimony.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal proceedings in the Southern District of New York, likely related to the Epstein/Maxwell case.
The defense team includes at least four attorneys: Christian Everdell, Bobbi C Sternheim, Jeff Pagliuca, and Laura Menninger.
The document shows formal communication between prosecution and defense teams regarding case procedures.
